channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ID
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ID

item.title: Report E-2023070610
item.description:
Report E-2023070610

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: MERIDIAN
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBI experienced a liquid UN1498 OxyFresh release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-ounces of product released impacting the tote body only due to a missing cap. Contractors replaced the cap and wiped the tote down for shipment on. The damaged cap and impacted rags were placed into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023070780
item.description:
Report X-2023070780

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: BOISE
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: AM QA discovered package leaking in unload. Employee put on proper PPE. Package was contained and placed in a lined hazmat bin. Bin was then placed in Hazmat cage under the air vent. DescribePack: The box was leaking and upon inspection, one out of the four bottles had a loose cap and the entire gallon of the content spilled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Employee put on proper PPE. Package was contained and placed in a lined hazmat bin. Bin was then placed in Hazmat cage under the air vent.
